statements.name: PROC GFONT
statements.description: The PROC GFONT statement can either create SAS/GRAPH fonts or display existing SAS/GRAPH fonts. The GFONT procedure names the font to be created or displayed. If the GFONT procedure creates a font, then an input data set name is required. You can modify the design and appearance of the fonts that you create or display, and specify a destination catalog for graphics output.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that the GFONT procedure uses to build the font.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: when displaying a font, specifies the name of the font to be displayed.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: when creating a font, specifies a name for the font that you are creating.

arguments.name: NOBUILD
arguments.description: specifies that the GFONT procedure is to display an existing font.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for the body of the characters.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS catalog in which to save the graphics output generated by the display of the font.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of the font characters in number of units, n.

arguments.name: NOKEYMAP
arguments.description: specifies that the current key map is ignored when displaying the font and its character codes or hexadecimal values.

arguments.name: NOROMAN
arguments.description: turns off the automatic display of character codes that are created when you use the SHOWROMAN option during font creation.

arguments.name: NOROMHEX
arguments.description: turns off the automatic display of hexadecimal values for single-byte characters.

arguments.name: REFCOL=
arguments.description: specifies a color for reference lines.

arguments.name: REFLINES
arguments.description: draws reference lines around each displayed character.

arguments.name: ROMCOL=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the character codes or hexadecimal values that are displayed with the SHOWROMAN and ROMHEX options.

arguments.name: ROMFONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font for character codes and hexadecimal values that are displayed by the SHOWROMAN and ROMHEX options.

arguments.name: ROMHEX
arguments.description: displays hexadecimal values below the font characters.

arguments.name: ROMHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of the character codes and the hexadecimal values that are displayed with the SHOWROMAN and ROMHEX options in number of units, n.

arguments.name: SHOWALL
arguments.description: displays the font with a space for every possible character position whether a font character exists for that position.

arguments.name: SHOWROMAN
arguments.description: displays character codes below the font characters even if they are not displayed automatically with the font.

arguments.name: BASELINE=
arguments.description: specifies the vertical coordinate in the font data set that is the baseline of the characters.

arguments.name: CAPLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the vertical coordinate in the font data set that is the capline of the characters.

arguments.name: CHARSPACETYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of intercharacter spacing.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: specifies that the first observation for each character sets the width of that character.

arguments.name: FIXED
arguments.description: adds a fixed amount of space between characters based on the font size.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that no space is added between characters.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: specifies that the amount of space that is used for each character is uniform, not proportional.

arguments.name: CODELEN=
arguments.description: specifies the length in bytes of the CHAR variable.

arguments.name: FILLED
arguments.description: specifies that the characters in a polygon font are filled.

arguments.name: KERNDATA=
arguments.description: specifies the data set that contains kerning information.

arguments.name: MWIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the width of a character in a uniform font, where character-width is the number of font units.

arguments.name: NODISPLAY
arguments.description: specifies that the GFONT procedure is not to display the font that it is creating.

arguments.name: NOKEYMAP
arguments.description: specifies that the current key map is ignored when you create and then use the font that is created.

arguments.name: RESOL=
arguments.description: controls the resolution of the fonts by specifying the number of bytes (1 through 4) for storing coordinates in the font.

arguments.name: ROMHEX
arguments.description: specifies that hexadecimal values are displayed automatically below the font characters when the GFONT procedure displays the font.

arguments.name: SHOWROMAN
arguments.description: specifies that character codes are displayed automatically below the font characters when the GFONT procedure displays the font.

arguments.name: SPACEDATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that contains font spacing information.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: specifies that characters are spaced uniformly rather than proportionately.

statements.name: NOTE
statements.description: Control the content, appearance, and placement of text.

arguments.name: ALT=
arguments.description: specifies descriptive text for a URL to which a note links, or the note itself.

arguments.name: ANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the baseline of the entire text string with respect to the horizontal.

arguments.name: BCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the background color of a box produced by the BOX= option.

arguments.name: BLANK=
arguments.description: protects the box and its contents from being overwritten by any subsequent graphics elements.

arguments.name: BOX=
arguments.description: draws a box around one line of text.

arguments.name: BSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of space between the boxed text and the box.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the following text, box, or line.

arguments.name: DRAW=
arguments.description: draws lines anywhere on the graphics output area.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font for the subsequent text.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of text characters in number of units.

arguments.name: JUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the text string.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the left.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: aligns the text in the center.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the right.

arguments.name: LANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the entire text-string(s).

arguments.name: LINK=
arguments.description: specifies a uniform resource locator (URL) to which a note links.

arguments.name: LSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of spacing above and below lines of text.

arguments.name: MOVE=
arguments.description: positions a text string.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which each character of text is rotated.

arguments.name: UNDERLIN=
arguments.description: underlines subsequent text.

arguments.name: WRAP
arguments.description: wraps the text to a second line if the text does not fit on one line.

arguments.name: #BYLINE
arguments.description: substitutes the entire BY line without leading or trailing blanks for #BYLINE in the text string. It also displays the BY line in the note produced by the statement.

arguments.name: #BYVAL
arguments.description: substitutes the current value of the specified BY variable for #BYVAL in the text string and displays the value produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these values:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAL should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable.

arguments.name: #BYVAR
arguments.description: substitutes the name of the BY variable or label associated with the variable (whatever the BY line would normally display) for #BYVAR in the text string and displays the name or label produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAR should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement. For example, #BYVAR2 specifies the second variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: BY-variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable. For example, #BYVAR(SITES) specifies the BY variable, SITES. Variable-name is not case sensitive.
